meanings.definition: To offer or present for acceptance.
meanings.sent1: She was proffering her help to anyone in need.
meanings.sent2: He proffered his hand in friendship to the new student.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept proffering the same trick, hoping for a different outcome.
meanings.sent4: The company was proffering a new product line to attract more customers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher proffered extra credit to motivate the students to study harder.

meanings.definition: The act of offering or presenting something for acceptance.
meanings.sent1: The proffering of gifts during the holidays brought joy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: His proffering of advice was always appreciated by his friends.
meanings.sent3: The proffering of snacks at the party made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: The proffering of apologies after the mistake was sincere.
meanings.sent5: The proffering of solutions to the problem helped resolve the issue quickly.
